intro: Cypholophus integer, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Cypholophus integer produces small, colorful blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a distinctive pattern on the petals. Its compact size and ease of care make it a favored choice for indoor gardening.
